CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {7} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Language Courses relative to the peak of Physical Education in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Language Courses is to the {right} of the peak of Physical Education.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing STEM Subjects show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing STEM Subjects shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Vocational Training reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Physical Education} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =55.5?
EVJ.A: At X =55.5,the label with the highest density is {Vocational Training}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 54? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Vocational Training}'s peak at {80},{Language Courses}'s peak at {85},{Humanities}'s peak at {83}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 25? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Physical Education}'s peak at {11},{STEM Subjects}'s peak at {11},{Arts}'s peak at {11},{Social Sciences}'s peak at {13}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Humanities or Vocational Training?
NC.A: {Humanities} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Vocational Training or Arts?
NC.A: {Vocational Training} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {3} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Physical Education}
